intro: Galium elegans var. punduanum, commonly known as the Punduana bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream sides. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
